actions.name: RIG_VOLUME_BOOST

parameters.name: boost_volume
parameters.comment:
Boost volume: A value in range [0..1] (corresponding to the range of the
rig volume parameter of the Kemper. Some examples: 0.5 is 0dB, 0.625 is +3dB, 0.75 is +6dB, 1.0 is +12dB

parameters.name: remember_off_value
parameters.comment: If set, the boost will return to the former rig volume at disabling

actions.comment: Volume boost function, based on setting rig volume to a certain boost value.

actions.name: ENCODER_RIG_TRANSPOSE

parameters.name: accept_action
parameters.comment:
Action to acknowledge the entered value. If None, the encoder directly sets values as you turn it. 
If you pass an Encoder Button action, the value will just be displayed and the MIDI command to set 
it will be sent when the Button action is triggered.

If you use this, you will also need a preview display label (see below)

parameters.name: cancel_action
parameters.comment: Action to cancel a preselection (only makes sense with accept_action set). Must be of type Encoder Button, too.

parameters.name: preview_display
parameters.comment:
If assigned, the adjusted value will be displayed in the passed DisplayLabel when the encoder is adjusted. 

This just makes sense in conjunction with an accept action (see above).

parameters.name: preview_blink_color
parameters.comment: Alternative color to be used when blinking.

parameters.name: preview_timeout_millis
parameters.comment:
This is the amount of time (milliseconds) after which the 
preview display will return to its normal state.

actions.comment: Adjusts the global rig transpose value.

actions.name: AMP_GAIN

parameters.name: step_width
parameters.comment: Increment/Decrement for one encoder step. Set to None for auto-detect (NRPN: 80, CC: 1)

parameters.name: accept_action
parameters.comment:
Action to acknowledge the entered value. If None, the encoder directly sets values as you turn it. 
If you pass an Encoder Button action, the value will just be displayed and the MIDI command to set 
it will be sent when the Button action is triggered.

If you use this, you will also need a preview display label (see below)

parameters.name: cancel_action
parameters.comment: Action to cancel a preselection (only makes sense with accept_action set). Must be of type Encoder Button, too.

parameters.name: preview_display
parameters.comment:
If assigned, the adjusted value will be displayed in the passed DisplayLabel when the encoder is adjusted. 

This just makes sense in conjunction with an accept action (see above).

parameters.name: preview_timeout_millis
parameters.comment:
This is the amount of time (milliseconds) after which the 
preview display will return to its normal state.

parameters.name: preview_blink_color
parameters.comment: Alternative color to be used when blinking.

actions.comment: Adjusts the amp gain with a rotary encoder.

actions.comment: Looper: Play/Rec/Overdub

actions.name: LOOPER_STOP

actions.name: LOOPER_ERASE

actions.name: LOOPER_CANCEL

actions.name: LOOPER_HALF_SPEED

actions.name: MORPH_BUTTON

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Can be "kemper" or a fixed color

parameters.name: morph_color_base
parameters.comment: Only used if color = "kemper". See MORPH_DISPLAY

parameters.name: morph_color_morphed
parameters.comment: Only used if color = "kemper". See MORPH_DISPLAY

actions.comment: Morph button (faded change of morph state)

actions.name: MORPH_DISPLAY

parameters.name: morph_color_base
parameters.comment: Color used for the unmorphed state

parameters.name: morph_color_morphed
parameters.comment: Color used for the morphed state

actions.comment: Morph state (display/LEDs only)

actions.name: ENCODER_BPM

parameters.name: step_width
parameters.comment: Increment/Decrement for one encoder step. Set to None for auto-detect (NRPN: 80, CC: 1)

parameters.name: accept_action
parameters.comment:
Action to acknowledge the entered value. If None, the encoder directly sets values as you turn it. 
If you pass an Encoder Button action, the value will just be displayed and the MIDI command to set 
it will be sent when the Button action is triggered.

If you use this, you will also need a preview display label (see below)

parameters.name: cancel_action
parameters.comment: Action to cancel a preselection (only makes sense with accept_action set). Must be of type Encoder Button, too.

parameters.name: preview_display
parameters.comment:
If assigned, the adjusted value will be displayed in the passed DisplayLabel when the encoder is adjusted. 

This just makes sense in conjunction with an accept action (see above).

parameters.name: preview_blink_color
parameters.comment: Alternative color to be used when blinking.

parameters.name: preview_timeout_millis
parameters.comment:
This is the amount of time (milliseconds) after which the 
preview display will return to its normal state.

actions.comment: Adjusts the BPM tempo with a rotary encoder.

actions.name: TAP_TEMPO
actions.comment: Tap tempo

actions.name: SHOW_TEMPO

parameters.name: change_display
parameters.comment: If a display label is passed here, the BPM value will be shown there shortly when changed.

parameters.name: change_timeout_millis
parameters.comment: If change_display is set, this determines how long the values shall be shown.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text for the main label. Can contain a {bpm} token which is replaced with the current BPM value.

parameters.name: led_brightness
parameters.comment: LED brightness in range [0..1]

actions.comment: Show tempo (blinks on every beat)

actions.name: EFFECT_STATE
actions.comment: Switch an effect slot on / off

actions.name: ENCODER_BANK_SELECT

parameters.name: preview_display
parameters.comment:
If assigned, the adjusted value will be displayed in the passed DisplayLabel when the encoder is adjusted. 

Bank Preselect is always shown in the Rig Name/ID display, regardless of this option. However, the preselect display is not updated too often so it makes total sense to set your rig name display here, too.

parameters.name: step_width
parameters.comment: Step width. Can be set to any value greater than 0 (including float values).

actions.comment:
Preselects the bank with a rotary encoder. 

After this, the bank change will be done after a rig has been selected.

actions.name: BANK_UP

parameters.name: dim_factor
parameters.comment: Can be "off", "on" or a value in range [0..1]

parameters.name: led_brightness
parameters.comment: Can be "off", "on" or a value in range [0..1]

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Override color (if no color_callback is passed)

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (same as for RIG_SELECT, see definitions above)

parameters.name: preselect
parameters.comment: Preselect mode. If enabled, the bank is only pre-selected, the change will only take effect when you select a rig next time.

parameters.name: max_bank
parameters.comment: Highest bank available. Only relevant if preselct is enabled.

actions.comment: Next bank (keeps rig index)

actions.name: BANK_DOWN

parameters.name: display
parameters.comment: Reference to a DisplayLabel

parameters.name: dim_factor
parameters.comment: Can be "off", "on" or a value in range [0..1]

parameters.name: led_brightness
parameters.comment: Can be "off", "on" or a value in range [0..1]

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Override color (if no color_callback is passed)

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (same as for RIG_SELECT, see definitions above)

parameters.name: preselect
parameters.comment: Preselect mode

parameters.name: max_bank
parameters.comment: Highest bank available. Only relevant if preselct is enabled.

actions.comment: Previous bank (keeps rig index)

actions.name: EFFECT_STATE_EXT
actions.comment: Switch an effect slot on / off. This variant has distinct names for each effect type. Use with care: This takes quite some RAM memory, so if you run a large configuration you might run into memory allocation failures. In this case, just use the normal Effect State action instead.

actions.name: RIG_SELECT_AND_MORPH_STATE

parameters.name: rig
parameters.comment: Rig to select. Range: [1..5]

parameters.name: rig_off
parameters.comment: If set, this defines the "off" rig chosen when the action is disabled. Set to "auto" to always remember the current rig as "off" rig

parameters.name: bank
parameters.comment: If set, a specific bank is selected. If None, the current bank is kept

parameters.name: bank_off
parameters.comment: If set, this defines the "off" bank to be chosen when the action is disabled. Set to "auto" to always remember the current bank as "off" bank

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Color override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (show color/text for current or target rig)

parameters.name: morph_display
parameters.comment: Optional DisplayLabel to show morph color

parameters.name: morph_use_leds
parameters.comment: Use the LEDs to show morph state?

parameters.name: morph_id
parameters.comment: Separate ID for the morph action. Default is the same id as specified with the "id" parameter.

parameters.name: morph_only_when_enabled
parameters.comment: Only show the morph state when the "on" rig is selected

parameters.name: morph_color_base
parameters.comment: See MORPH_DISPLAY

parameters.name: morph_color_morphed
parameters.comment: See MORPH_DISPLAY

parameters.name: rig_btn_morph
parameters.comment: If set True, second press will trigger toggling the internal morphing state (no command is sent, just the displays are toggled). Only if no rig_off or bank_off are specified.

actions.comment: Adds morph state display on one LED to the rig select action. The morph display will only be enabled when the rig in question is currently selected.

actions.name: RIG_UP

parameters.name: keep_bank
parameters.comment:
If enabled, the bank is not changed when at the first and last rigs of a bank. If disabled, 
the banks are stepped up/down after the last/first rigs of a bank.

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (see definitions above)

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Color override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text override (if no text callback is passed)

actions.comment: Select next rig

actions.name: RIG_DOWN

parameters.name: keep_bank
parameters.comment:
If enabled, the bank is not changed when at the first and last rigs of a bank. If disabled, 
the banks are stepped up/down after the last/first rigs of a bank.

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (see definitions above)

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Color override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text override (if no text callback is passed)

actions.comment: Select previous rig

actions.name: RIG_SELECT

parameters.name: rig
parameters.comment: Rig to select. Range: [1..5] or None to re-select the current rig.

parameters.name: rig_off
parameters.comment: If set, this defines the "off" rig chosen when the action is disabled. Set to "auto" to always remember the current rig as "off" rig

parameters.name: bank
parameters.comment: If set, a specific bank is selected. If None, the current bank is kept

parameters.name: bank_off
parameters.comment: If set, this defines the "off" bank to be chosen when the action is disabled. Set to "auto" to always remember the current bank as "off" bank

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode (show color/text for current or target rig)

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the color. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Color override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback for setting the text. Footprint: def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are int starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text override (if no text callback is passed)

parameters.name: auto_exclude_rigs
parameters.comment: If rig_off is "auto", this can be filled with a tuple or list of rigs to exclude from "remembering" when disabled

parameters.name: rig_btn_morph
parameters.comment: If set True, second press will trigger toggling the internal morphing state (no command is sent, just the displays are toggled). Only if no rig_off or bank_off are specified.

actions.comment: Selects a specific rig, or toggles between two rigs (if rig_off is also provided).

actions.name: TUNER_MODE
actions.comment: Switch tuner mode on / off

actions.name: EFFECT_BUTTON

parameters.name: num
parameters.comment: Number of the Effect Button (1 to 4)

parameters.name: use_internal_state
parameters.comment: If enabled, the state of the display will be toggled no matter what the real status on the Kemper is (the Kemper sadly does not report the state at all).

actions.comment: Effect Button I-IIII (set only). num must be a number (1 to 4). NOTE: The state of the display will be toggled no matter what the real status on the Kemper is (the Kemper sadly does not report the state at all). If you dont want this behaviour, you can set "use_internal_state = False".

actions.name: BANK_SELECT

parameters.name: bank
parameters.comment: Bank to select. Banks are indexed starting from one, range: [1..126].

parameters.name: bank_off
parameters.comment: "off" bank, to toggle between banks. Will be ignored when preselect is enabled.

parameters.name: preselect
parameters.comment: Preselect mode. If enabled, the bank is only pre-selected, the change will only take effect when you select a rig next time. Ignores the parameter "bank_off".

parameters.name: display_mode
parameters.comment: Display mode

parameters.name: display
parameters.comment: Reference to a DisplayLabel

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: ID for paging / enable callbacks

parameters.name: use_leds
parameters.comment: Use the switch LEDs

parameters.name: enable_callback
parameters.comment: Optional callback to enable/disable the action depeinding on things

parameters.name: color_callback
parameters.comment:
Optional callback for setting the color. Scheme: 
def callback(action, bank, rig) -> (r, g, b) where bank and rig are integers starting from 0.

parameters.name: color
parameters.comment: Static color (if no color callback is passed)

parameters.name: text_callback
parameters.comment:
Callback for setting the text. Scheme: 
def callback(action, bank, rig) -> String where bank and rig are integers starting from 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Static text (if no text callback is passed)

actions.comment: Selects a specific bank, keeping the current rig, or toggles between two banks (if bank_off is also provided).

actions.name: ENCODER_BUTTON
actions.comment:
This simple action is used in conjunction with a rotary encoder: If you assign this to an encoder action using its "accept_action" parameter, the encoder will not send any value until this switch is pushed.

You can also use this to cancel the preselection, see Encoder Action's parameter "cancel_action".

It makes the most sense assigned to an encoder wheel's own pushbutton, but technically it can be assigned to any switch.

actions.name: CUSTOM_MESSAGE

parameters.name: message
parameters.comment: Raw MIDI message bytes (as list, for example [176, 80, 0] for a control change). You can use hex values in format 0xab, too.

parameters.name: message_release
parameters.comment: Raw MIDI message to be sent on releasing the button (default: None)

parameters.name: led_brightness
parameters.comment: LED brighness in range [0..1]

actions.comment:
Sends a raw, arbitrary MIDI message.

The messages have to be raw bytes, so don't forget to also add the status and (in case of SysEx) closing bytes!

actions.name: PARAMETER_UP_DOWN

parameters.name: offset
parameters.comment: Offset to be added to the parameter value. The range for this depends on whether the mapping's set message is a SysEx ([0..16383]) or ControlChange ([0..127]).

parameters.name: repeat_interval_millis
parameters.comment: If set to a value different than 0 or None, the action is repeated when the switch is held down (only works if the action is not in a "hold" position). Also note that this cannot be faster than the general update period which is set to 200ms per default.

parameters.name: max_value
parameters.comment: Max. value. If None, this is derived automatically from the mapping (SysEx: 16383, CC: 127).

parameters.name: display
parameters.comment: Display label to show the value and color.

parameters.name: change_display
parameters.comment: Can be assigned to an additonal display label which is used to show the changed values for a period of time.

parameters.name: change_timeout_millis
parameters.comment: Amount of time the value is shown in the change display, if change_display is set.

parameters.name: text
parameters.comment: Text for the main display parameter's label. Can contain {val} which will be replaced with the current parameter value (percentage in range [0..100])

parameters.name: led_brightness
parameters.comment: LED brightness for max value

actions.comment:
Can be used for all parameter mappings: Increases or decreases the parameter value by a given offset. 

Optionally, the current value can be shown in a display label, and/or be previewed in another display label (the rig name for example).

actions.name: HID_KEYBOARD

parameters.name: keycodes
parameters.comment:
Key code(s) to send. Can be either a single key code or a list/tuple of key codes. 
Search "adafruit_hid.keycode" for available key codes, for example Keycode.LEFT_ARROW.

actions.comment:
Sends a HID (Human Interface Device) command which emulates an USB keyboard. 

With this, the controller can work as an USB page turner for example.

actions.name: BINARY_SWITCH
actions.comment: Generic switch action which can be used for all parameter mappings

actions.name: AnalogAction

parameters.name: mapping
parameters.comment: Parameter mapping to be controlled

parameters.name: max_frame_rate
parameters.comment: Maximum frame rate for sending MIDI values (fps)

parameters.name: max_value
parameters.comment: Maximum value of the mapping (16383 for NRPN, 127 for CC) Set this to None to auto-detect these ranges.

parameters.name: num_steps
parameters.comment: Number of steps to be regarded as different (saves MIDI traffic at the cost of precision).

parameters.name: enable_callback
parameters.comment: Callback to set enabled state (optional). Must contain an enabled(action) function.

parameters.name: auto_calibrate
parameters.comment: Auto-calibrate (similar to Kemper devices)

parameters.name: cal_min_window
parameters.comment: Minimum calibration range in percent [0..1]. A value of 0.25 means that the pedal has to cover at least 25% of the full range to be regarded.

parameters.name: transfer_function
parameters.comment:
Transfer function. Input is the raw encoder value in range [0..65535]. Must return the value to be sent for 
the mapping, in its range. If used, this disables the num_steps and max_value parameters.

NOTE: When designing your transfer function, take care that the output values do not change too often as this 
imposes performance issues!

parameters.name: change_display
parameters.comment: If assigned, the adjusted value will be displayed in the passed DisplayLabel when the pedal is adjusted.

parameters.name: change_timeout_millis
parameters.comment: This is the amount of time (milliseconds) after which the preview display will return to its normal state.

parameters.name: convert_value
parameters.comment: Optional conversion routine for displaying values: (value) => string

actions.comment: Use this action for all analog inputs like expression pedals.

actions.name: EncoderAction

parameters.name: mapping
parameters.comment: Parameter mapping to be controlled

parameters.name: min_value
parameters.comment: Minimum value of the mapping

parameters.name: max_value
parameters.comment: Maximum value of the mapping (set to None for auto-detect: 16383 for NRPN, 127 for CC)

parameters.name: step_width
parameters.comment: Increment/Decrement for one encoder step. Set to None for auto-detect (NRPN: 80, CC: 1). Can be set to any value greater than 0 (including float values).

parameters.name: enable_callback
parameters.comment: Callback to set enabled state (optional). Must contain an enabled(action) function.

parameters.name: accept_action
parameters.comment:
Action to acknowledge the entered value. If None, the encoder directly sets values as you turn it. 
If you pass an Encoder Button action, the value will just be displayed and the MIDI command to set 
it will be sent when the Button action is triggered.

If you use this, you will also need a preview display label (see below)

parameters.name: cancel_action
parameters.comment: Action to cancel a preselection (only makes sense with accept_action set). Must also be of type Encoder Button.

parameters.name: preview_display
parameters.comment:
If assigned, the adjusted value will be displayed in the passed DisplayLabel when the encoder is adjusted. 
This just makes sense in conjunction with an accept action (see above).

parameters.name: preview_timeout_millis
parameters.comment: This is the amount of time (milliseconds) after which the preview display will return to its normal state.

parameters.name: preview_blink_period_millis
parameters.comment: Blink period for preview (if an accept action is set)

parameters.name: preview_blink_color
parameters.comment: Alternative color to be used when blinking.

parameters.name: preview_reset_mapping
parameters.comment: A parameter mapping (optional) which will be tracked. If the value changes, the preselect mode will be reset.

parameters.name: convert_value
parameters.comment: Optional conversion routine for displaying values: (value) => string

actions.comment:
Use this action for all rotary encoders like wheels. The push-down switch of the encoder is 
not addressed here: This is represented as a separate switch, and can be linked to the same actions as a normal foot switch.

actions.name: PagerAction

parameters.name: pages
select_page
parameters.comment:
If None, the pages will be rotated. If set to a page ID, the action will select the passed page (use a 
"Select Page" action for directly selecting the other pages)

parameters.name: led_brightness
parameters.comment: LED brightness for the pager in range [0..1]. Only used when selet_page is None (rotate mode).

parameters.name: led_brightness_off
parameters.comment: LED brightness for the pager when select_page is set and the page is not currently selected. Range [0..1].

parameters.name: led_brightness_on
parameters.comment: LED brightness for the pager when select_page is set and the page is currently selected. Range [0..1].

parameters.name: mappings
parameters.comment: List of mappings the paging depends on (optional)

actions.comment: The PagerAction is used to control multiple other actions to provide paging. Define this action for one switch which will by default rotate through the defined pages. For the actions you want to be part of pages, just assign them using the paging buttons (which will set the id and enable_callback parameters for you). Also, it is possible to have more than one pager in a configuration. Rotate Through Pages: If you want to rotate through pages, just use this action with select_page set to None, which is the default. The switch will then rotate through the pages. Directly Select Pages: If you want to have one switch dedicated to select each page, set select_page here to the page you want to select with the switch this pager is assigned to, and use the "Select Page" action (assigned to this pager) for the other switches to select the further pages directly.

actions.name: PagerAction.proxy

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.comment: Sets the page to be selected with this action

actions.comment:
This controls a Pager Action from another switch, making it possible to directly select pages with dedicated switches. You always need to have a Pager Action which defines the pages, which also MUST be assigned to a switch. Set "select_page" on this pager to the first page, and for selecting the other pages, create "Select Page" actions for other switches. For example, to have 3 pages and 3 switches:
  • Switch 1: Pager Action with "select_page" set to the first page
  • Switch 2: Select Page action set to page 2
  • Switch 3: Select Page action set to page 3
The LED and display brightness settings are determined from the connected pager and can be set there if needed.
